author: Tom Jowitt
title: Microsoft Cuts Hundreds Of Gaming Staff
text: Microsoft Cuts Hundreds Of Gaming Staff Post Activision – Microsoft Gaming confirms it will axe 650 employees, after thousands of job losses earlier this year Microsoft Gaming CEO confirms more bad news for employees with another round of painful layoffs for back-end corporate staff. In an email, Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer confirmed that a further 650 staff would be cut from across the organisation, admitting “this is difficult news to hear,” [Windows Central reported](https://www.windowscentral.com/gaming/xbox/i-know-that-this-is-difficult-news-to-hear-new-microsoft-gaming-layoffs-hit-xbox-ceo-phil-spencer-announces-650-redundancies-in-email-to-staff). It comes after it announced in June that Microsoft’s[ Xbox chief marketing officer Jerret West was to leave](https://www.silicon.co.uk/e-management/jobs/microsoft-xbox-marketing-chief-568388) the company to become the chief marketing officer at Roblox. Gaming layoffs It should be remembered that Redmond’s gaming division has been undergoing significant restructuring in 2024 after [Microsoft completed](https://www.silicon.co.uk/e-enterprise/merger-acquisition/cma-microsoft-activision-3-534077) its protracted $75 billion (£59bn) acquisition of Activision Blizzard in November 2023, and amidst broader spending weakness in the industry. In January [Microsoft cut 9 percent of the gaming division staff](https://www.silicon.co.uk/e-management/lay-off/microsoft-axes-1900-staff-after-activision-acquisition-547498), or about 1,900 workers. With this week’s 650 job losses (which equates to 3 percent of all staff) Microsoft has eliminated more than 2,550 gaming roles so far in 2024. Now in his email to staff (see below) Phil Spencer emphasised that [no studios are being closed](https://www.silicon.co.uk/e-management/jobs/riot-games-layoffs-546832) and no devices are being cancelled. Spencer elaborated that the redundancies will fall “mostly” in corporate teams and their supporting functions, namely things like HR, finance, and marketing. Some media reports however have indicated that Microsoft has reduced the “Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile” team, which included a combination of layoffs and transfers to other projects. Phil Spencer email “For the past year, our goal has been to minimise disruption while welcoming new teams and enabling them to do their best work. As part of aligning our post-acquisition team structure and managing our business, we have made the decision to eliminate approximately 650 roles across Microsoft Gaming – mostly corporate and supporting functions – to organise our business for long term success. I know that this is difficult news to hear. We are deeply grateful for the contributions of our colleagues who are learning they are impacted. In the US, we’re supporting them with exit packages that include severance, extended healthcare, and outplacement services to help with their transition; outside the US packages will differ according to location. With these changes, our corporate and supporting teams and resources are aligned for sustainable future growth, and can better support our studio teams and business units with programs and resources that can scale to meet their needs. Separately, as part of running the business, there are some impacts to other teams as they adapt to shifting priorities and manage the lifecycle and performance of games. No games, devices or experiences are being cancelled and no studios are being closed as part of these adjustments today. Throughout our team’s history, we have had great moments, and we have had challenging ones. Today is one of the challenging days. I know that going through more changes like this is hard, but even in the most trying times, this team has been able to come together and show one another care and kindness as we work to continue delivering for our players. We appreciate your support as we navigate these changes and we thank you for your compassion and respect for each other. Phil” Post Activision Microsoft Gaming was created with the announcement of Redmond’s plans to acquire Activision Blizzard to unify all of Microsoft’s gaming groups within a single division. But the division faces challenges as Xbox hardware sales continue to decline year-over-year. However as a division, Xbox is making more money than ever thanks to a number of big name gaming brands such as World of Warcraft, and the gaming juggernaut that is Call of Duty. The acquisition of Activision Blizzard was always going to result in internal restructuring and job losses at Microsoft. In May, Microsoft closed down three studios namely Arkane Austin, Alpha Dog Studios and Tango Gameworks, run by its subsidiary Bethesda Softworks. Microsoft also reportedly merged a fourth studio called Roundhouse Games with its “The Elder Scrolls Online” team under ZeniMax Online Studios.

author: archyde
title: F1 – Alpine: Ocon points out team’s failings
text:
2024-07-25 15:50:33
Posted on July 25, 2024 at 5:50 pm – Updated on July 25, 2024 at 5:52 pm
Matthew Warnier
Although Esteban Ocon will join Haas next season, he spoke about the results crisis that the Alpine team is going through, unfortunately not hearing this from a technical point of view.
Esteban Ocon no longer has any reason to remain silent. As he completes his fifth season with Alpine, the Evreux native has put an end to the open secrecy surrounding his future. The French driver, who scored his first F1 victory in Hungary three years ago, has signed a multi-season deal with Haas just weeks after confirming his departure from the team. He had the opportunity to offer a less-than-kind view of working at Alpine. In his eyes, ” There are many things that are not done as they should be done ”. Like any of his former or current teammates, the Norman claims to have “shared a lot of information about the development of the car”, but this is not reflected in the evolution of the equipment provided to him. ” Unfortunately, our feedback is not always translated into concrete action, and sometimes our opinions are not heard as much as they deserve. “, he added. Diagnosing Alpine’s problems, Esteban Ocon assured that despite the many changes in the team’s organizational structure, the problems encountered were not recent.
O’Connell: “This circle is not complete yet” « We can’t wait years to solve certain problems he promised. The cycle is not over yet, and the problem has not been solved as it should be. , which is frustrating for everyone. » Asked whether Groupe Renault had invested enough in its Formula One team, Esteban Ocon said he was sure it was “not a question of money”. ” The team has many resources, with factories located in Viry-Châtillon and Enstone on the Alpine side “, he added. While Alpine should start a new chapter in its history in 2026 through a technical partnership with Mercedes, Esteban Ocon will be observing this from a distance, having started from next season Starting with Oliver Bellman at Haas, he will be keeping a close eye on the situation with his former team. I hope she can be competitive again like she was in the past ”, concludes the Norman. There are a lot of new technicians and I wish them all the best. I won’t be there to see how it turns out, but I hope this brand can shine again . »The upcoming decisions of Flavio Briatore and Bruno Farming will be key for France’s future.
1721941738
#Alpine #Ocon #points #teams #failings

author: Fernando H. Valls
title: Jeff Bezos competirá con Elon Musk en España por ofrecer internet de bajo coste
text:
La batalla empresarial entre las dos personas más ricas del mundo se traslada a España. Amazon Kuiper, la división del gigante tecnológico para proporcionar internet de alta velocidad y barato a través de satélites de órbita baja, ha logrado la autorización del Gobierno para poder operar. De esta forma, la compañía de Jeff Bezos, cuyo abuelo nació en un pueblo de Valladolid, ultima su desembarco en este negocio para competir directamente contra Elon Musk y Starlink, la división que ya desarrolla su actividad en prácticamente todo el país y que ofrece acceso a servicios de banda ancha a precios asequibles.
La filial de Amazon solicitó autorización al Ministerio para la Transformación Digital el año pasado y recibió el visto bueno el 9 de diciembre, según confirman fuentes cercanas a la empresa. De momento, la compañía de Bezos no ha comenzado a ofrecer sus servicios comerciales a nivel mundial, pero el despliegue es inminente. En el mercado español la llegada se debería producir este año, pero antes tiene que habilitar instalaciones de comunicaciones de la señal de los satélites. La compañía está estudiando varias ubicaciones. A partir de entonces Amazon ya podrá ofrecer a particulares su servicio de conexión rápida y asequible.
Amazon, de hecho, quiere especializarse como proveedor de internet en la España vaciada. La propia compañía explica en su página web que “miles de millones de personas en todo el mundo no tienen acceso seguro a la banda ancha” y que “una conectividad deficiente significa un acceso limitado a las comunicaciones modernas, la educación, los servicios de salud y otros recursos importantes, lo que puede crear una desventaja económica para comunidades desatendidas y subatendidas”.
Amazon avanza un servicio de internet a 29 euros al mes para plantar cara a las tarifas que ofrece Starlink
El hecho de dirigirse a la España rural es una diferencia reseñable con Starlink, que ya opera en todo el país a nivel civil, especialmente en grandes ciudades, donde, incluso, cuenta con zonas saturadas por la cantidad de clientes que tiene. Es el caso de un territorio situado entre Madrid y Guadalajara. En el resto del mundo hay más zonas saturadas, como San Diego, Sacramento o Austin, en Estados Unidos; y Londres y alrededores, donde el servicio está “agotado”. En Andorra tampoco hay cobertura de la compañía de Musk en este momento.
Amazon va a comenzar en los próximos meses a poner en órbita los satélites que darán cobertura a este servicio de internet en todo el mundo. Lo hará a través de sus cohetes New Glenn, de su compañía Blue Origin, que aspira a competir con los aparatos autopropulsados de SpaceX, de Elon Musk. La competición también se está librando en este terreno. Amazon calcula que tendrá más de 3.000 aparatos en órbita, frente a los 6.000 de Musk.
Los satélites de Amazon para ofrecer internet se están fabricando en Kirkland (Washington), en unas instalaciones que se inauguraron en abril. El lanzamiento de los mismos se producirá en Florida, donde la compañía de Bezos ha reforzado su presencia en el Centro Espacial Kennedy con una nueva instalación para este proyecto.
La compañía tecnológica quiere especializarse en ser el proveedor para zonas rurales y despobladas
Los clientes de Amazon Kuiper tendrán un receptor que le permitirá acceder a Internet. La compañía explica que ya dispone de tres modelos, uno ultracompaco de 100 Mbps, otro estándar de 400 Mbps y un tercero para empresas o gobiernos de un gigabyte por segundo. La compañía de Bezos añade que aún no ha concretado los precios de cada servicio, pero sí avanza que serán de bajo coste, al igual que sus dispositivos más populares, como el altavoz Echo Dot y la línea de streaming de Fire TV Stick.
Starlink, por su parte, ofrece Internet para hogares, para usuarios que quieran desplazarse o para llevarlo en embarcaciones. También para empresas y gobiernos. La gama de precio varía desde los 29 euros hasta los 360 euros al mes. La pugna por los clientes en España entre los dos magnates estadounidenses está servida.
Hispasat y las comunicaciones del Gobierno
Una de las compañías que se verá afectada por la irrupción de Amazon Kuiper en España es Hispasat, la sociedad pública que ofrece servicios de acceso a internet por satélite en todas las regiones de España. El precio comercial que ofrece la firma presidida por el exministro Pedro Duque es de 35 euros al mes por un servicio con una velocidad de 100 Mbps, ligeramente por encima del servicio básico de Starlink. La competencia privada perjudica comercialmente a la compañía dependiente de la Sociedad Estatal de Participaciones Industriales (SEPI). La pugna por el cliente con las compañías de Musk y Bezos también está siendo un motivo para que no cristalice la adquisición de la sociedad por parte de Indra. La también corporación pública sigue estudiando la operación y tiene dudas para ejecutarla. Esencialmente por el precio que se está manejando para cerrar una compra en un mercado muy competitivo a nivel mundial y cambiante. La irrupción de Amazon en España no afecta a las comunicaciones seguras del Gobierno a través de los satélites, que siguen dependiendo de Hisdesat. La compañía está a punto de poner en órbita el satélite más moderno de Europa.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: STAY INFORMED: Over 2 dozen delays, closures reported due to slick roads this morning
text:
By WHIO Staff ,
1 hours ago Over two dozen delays and closures have been announced due to slick roads this morning.
[DOWNLOAD: Free WHIO-TV News app for alerts as news breaks ]
Benjamin Logan Schools in Logan County is closed this morning. Riverside Local Schools in Logan County is delayed by 2 hours and there will be no morning preschool.
Ohio Hi-Point Career Center in Logan County is also delayed by 2 hours.
In Champaign County, four districts are delayed by 2 hours. Mercy Health Urbana Cardiac Rehab in Champaign County is also on a 2-hour delay.
Nine districts in Miami County are delayed by 2 hours, including Troy City Schools and Piqua City Schools. Nicholas School in Miami County is also delayed by 2 hours.
Nine districts in Shelby County are delayed by 2 hours. Sidney Holy Angels in Shelby County is delayed 2 hours and there will be no morning preschool.
Minster Local Schools in Auglaize County and Greenville City Schools in Darke County are delayed by 2 hours.
News Center 7 will continue to track any closings or delays and update this story.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: American-Canadian-Israeli woman believed to be held hostage in Gaza pronounced dead
text: A hard-hit Israeli kibbutz on Thursday announced the death of Judith Weinstein — an American-Canadian-Israeli woman who had been thought to be held hostage in Gaza . The news came six days after Weinstein's husband, Gad Haggai, was also pronounced dead. Weinstein, 70, and Haggai, 73, were taking an early morning walk near their home in Kibbutz Nir Oz on the morning of Oct. 7 when Hamas militants burst across the border into Israel, killing about 1,200 people and kidnapping 240 others. In the early hours of the morning, Weinstein was able to call emergency services and let them know that both she and her husband had been shot and send a message to her family. Weinstein and her husband had been thought to be among the hostages still held in captivity in Gaza. But six days ago, the kibbutz announced that Haggai was killed Oct. 7 and his body was taken to Gaza. On Thursday, the kibbutz said it had learned that Weinstein was also killed on Oct. 7 and her body is also being held in Gaza. It was not immediately clear how Israeli authorities determined their deaths. The couple are survived by two sons and two daughters and seven grandchildren, the kibbut said. President Joe Biden said he was “devastated” to learn of Weinstein's death, especially after hearing about the couple during a meeting with their daughter. The families "have been living through hell for weeks. No family should have to endure such an ordeal,” he said in a statement. Weinstein was born in New York and was an active member of Kibbutz Nir Oz, a small community near the Gaza border where she taught English to children with special needs. The kibbutz said she also taught meditation techniques to children and teenagers who suffered from anxiety as a result of rocket fire from Gaza. Haggai was a retired chef and jazz musician. “Judy dedicated her life to serving others, spending years teaching English and using her passions for poetry, puppeteering, and mindfulness to empower children of all backgrounds,” her family said in a statement. Al Haggai, one of the couple's sons, told Israel's Channel 13 that the family had originally hoped their mother's multiple citizenships would allow her to be released during the week-long ceasefire in late November, when 105 hostages were let go. Almost all were women and children. He said that when his mother's name was not on any of the daily lists, he started to suspect that something happened to her. According to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office, at least 23 of the approximately 129 hostages believed to be held in Gaza have either died or been killed in captivity. Nir Oz was one of the hardest-hit Israeli communities on Oct. 7, with roughly one- quarter of its residents killed or kidnapped. The families of missing hostages have drawn widespread support and sympathy in Israel as they press the government to reach a new cease-fire deal to bring home their loved-ones. Netanyahu met Thursday in Tel Aviv with some of the families, where he told them there were behind-the-scene efforts to bring the hostages home, according to a statement from his office. “I can’t elaborate on the details, we are working to return everyone,” he said.

author: MCK1
title: Re: Re : passage à la fibre - Communauté Orange
text:
suite a de multiple coupure internet, on me dit qu'il faut installer la fibre et que cela sera obligatoire sous peu.
et la on m'impose le changement.
Mon contrat à été modifié sur le champ en sachant qu'il prévoyait le changement pour mars. et naturellement le nouveau prix avec application immédiat aussi. Est ce normal.?
et il faut aussi savoir que la personne que j'avais au bout du fil à trainé presque 1 heure et m'a pratiquement vidé mon accès appel .
Merci a ceux qui me répondrons.
